Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet but central location”
Reviews.Author: dizzydavew
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, stayed for two nights. Right in the heart of latin quarter, with all the restaurants and bars within a few feet of hotel. Hotel was very clean, rooms were of reasonable size for a european capital. Great views out of rooms over the tops of parisian roof tops. Front desk staff were always happy to advice on things to do and where to go. All in all a great little hotel. Be aware Paris is now very very expensive, unless you are a local you are seen as easy target to exhort every last euro out of you. This is not just down to the exchange rate, but shady practices by restaurant, bar and cafe owners. Paris is one of the great cities of the word but it will not remain like this if these practices are continued.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, high standard, reasonable price, apprehensive staff”
Reviews.Author: therider0
Reviews.Content: 310 € for 2 nigths in the heart of quartier latin, but in a very quite street. Nice room with large windows facing the french roofs, clean, with duvet, confortable matrass and very friendly, polite and apprehensive staff. I looked in tripsdvisor for weeks before choosing and I am very very happy! Definitely to recommend and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Allie17
Reviews.Content: This hotel location could not be better for St Michel, Notre Dam, Maria area, Ile St Louis, Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens etc etc... Just round the corner from The Shakespeare Co. book store too. We had a brilliant room on the 6th floor - views across the Paris roof tops over towards the Pantheon - also had a view of the Eiffel Tower, which I was delighted about! It was our honeymoon and so we were delighted with the romantic feeling and the views from the room. We even had a small balcony which we could both easily fit on, where we ate our lunch of fresh french bread, cheese and ham, and enjoyed the views, what more do you need in Paris!! Room size was excellent for a classic double room, and great size bathroom with bath and shower. Staff were super friendly, all spoke excellent English,but were also very patient when my wife was trying her french out. Very quiet little street, we could not hear anything once we were upstairs. The room and hotel was very clean, and room was serviced every day. Also had tea/coffee making facilities in room for free, and mini-bar fridge if needed. Also, there is a bookshef area in reception which is full of travel books and novels which you can borrow, so we had a great Paris book that we took out with us for the few days we were there. We did not try the breakfast here, but you don't really need to - the area is full of cafes etc. that you can eat in. There was a brilliant boulengerie around the corner, next to Hotel D'Albe which we had a great breakfast in - yoghurts, coffee, fresh orange juice, and danish/croissant - for 13euro for 2 people, which is very reasonable for Paris. Overall, we would recommend this hotel to everyone we know - very good price, great room, great location, friendly staff and very clean!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cristina C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel because the personal service is excellent. The location of his hotel is the best, You can visit the best places of Paris on walk and the metro station is a five minuts of the hotel. Breakfast is expensive for spanish people but are more complete.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great spot”
Reviews.Author: Lizh73
Reviews.Content: Booked here very short notice and got a great deal via lastminute - on arrival, the very helpful friendly manager showed us a choice of rooms and gave us an option to upgrade for a very, very reasonable price. We took room 70 - the top floor, a huge room by Paris standards with an enormous wrap round balcony with fantastic views. From here you can see all the major obvious landmarks - Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower, Sacre Coeur and the Pantheon - we thought that was pretty cool. Lovely spacious room, well equipped, very comfortable bed. Lovely spacious bathroom. Hotel was cool, elegant and very clean/well kept. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. The other rooms we saw (the standard one, as booked, and a slightly superior one) were both nice - we would have been happy with the standard one, as it was clean and comfortable, but we felt like pushing the boat out) We didn't take breakfast as we thought it expensive but there are plenty of excellent options very close by. The hotel is situated in the Latin Quarter which can be busy and noisy but the hotel is tucked away and we weren't bothered by any noise. Very close walking distance to Metro (St Michel/Cluny) and to many major landmarks. Loads of good restaurants/bars nearby. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: niall s
Reviews.Content: The Parc St Severin is a well kept and ideally situated hotel if you're visiting Paris. Close to many of the cities attractions and with great transport links, it is ideal. The cost of the rooms is very reasonable for Paris and although some of the glitz and glamour of the top hotels is missing here, so is some of the cost. The rooms are very comfortable and we did not have any issues with noise although that said we are deep sleepers. Nice, clean and very reasonably priced, perfect for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ron-DK
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 days and had chosen a superior room. Nice clean room with plenty of space. Very freindly and helpful staff. The hotel is situated in a nice quiet area with lots of restaurants and cafes. The hotel breakfast is 14€ which I find expensive - in stead go to one of the cafes around the corner- a full breakfast cost approx. 10€. Will definetely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away in a quiet section of a bustling area”
Reviews.Author: s0ulffle
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights over the weekend and it was a good experience with Hotel Parc St. Severin. It's located in a very convenient location in the 5th Arrd (I would suggest tourists to stay in this area - it's a hop and skip away from many sights and if you venture a little off the tourist track, you get to see a lot). Anyway, this hotel is just 3-5 minutes walk from the nearest exit (Exit 6 on the RER B line) - I was pleasantly surprised by how convenient it is. There's free wifi - a plus for those of us who love to be connected. Some downsides would be the bathroom. It's spacious but doesn't look too clean. I was hoping to soak in the tub but the (slight) mould on the wall and (some) chipped tiles put me off completely. Another downside was the thin walls. We had our neighbour watching tv at 11:30pm, and 7:30am. And we could hear the phone ringing in the next room. That was the most unpleasant part because the bed is really comfortable and it would be nice to just sleep uninterrupted! All in all, I would recommend Parc St Severin still. It's a pretty good price and excellent quiet location (unless you have a neighbour who doesn't need much sleep).

Reviews.Title: “Incredible little hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Julianer
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights with our baby at this hotel, and the staff was incredible! All very helpful and nice! Good size of the room for the european standards... For us, was even better as we had help of Carol, another brazilian who works there!! Amazing location, lots of things near, metro, restaurants, pharmacies, and snacks!! I definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: aga_dan
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a three night stay in this hotel. I really didn't know what to expect as I have never been to Paris before and I have chosen this hotel based on good ranking and reviews left by other travellers on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed. The rooms, as expected, are quite small but that's the last thing you should worry about if you are planning, like myself, to spend most of the time walking around Paris. The room 21 we stayed in was on the second floor with a beautiful view on local church. The room was very quiet with a big, comfy bed. The bathroom was quite big compared to the room itself and the whole place was kept clean throughout our stay. The hotel is located not even 1min away from Cluny - La Sorbonne Metro Station and about 2 min away from Saint-Michel Station, there are also few bus stops round the area that will take you to any monuments and lanmarks you wish to visit. If you prefer to walk instead of taking local transport, you won't be disapponted either. In less than 5min you can admire Notre Dame Cathedral, Pantheon, Sorbonne, St Germain Street with it's beautiful restaurant and cafes and much, much more. . Would definitely recommend to everyone and will be coming back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip with my 7 year old”
Reviews.Author: Leakyh
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff so friendly & helpful! You were so supportive of our needs so thank you - the room was fantastic, great decor & my son said the bed was better than home! The hotel is in a quiet pictureque location but still in the heart of the action - you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the nice place to stay in Paris st germain area”
Reviews.Author: gorichville
Reviews.Content: Its a good place to stay. Its in a unique location. Beside it is the church and at the corner a line of food restaurants. Its quite and peaceful place. Its near st germain de pre and odeon. We always stay here during our trips in Paris. You can also try hotel du fleurie http://www.hoteldefleurieparis.com/. Its a perfect location just across bucci latin but the rooms are smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sariano
Reviews.Content: Clean, well kept and near Metro station. Very atentive staff. Room quite small but that's Normal Parissian standard. Very close to Bd St. germain in a young and active part of town near the Sorbonne, Notre Damme and the Quartier Latin. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel and Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Catherine b
Reviews.Content: DuIring our recent stay[our return to this Hotel] i lost my camera on last day. i had left it at "Laudree" Patisserie and Hotel offered to ring and check. It was not found however hotel asked if it was could they ring the hotel back. My husband and I were on our way to airport to return to Australia and hotel rang our shuttle driver to speak to me and tell me they had my camera. The staff were so caring and went beyond everything to ring us as we had already left. I will always remember their efforts and not hesitate to recommend this hotel. it is a lovely small hotel, in a great area, clean and the staff go out of their way to help you. Merci Beaucoup! Catherine Bickford

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: alemarchi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend an I stayed for 4 days in September and we simply loved everything. The hotel was recommended by a friend of mine,and it couldn't have been better. The location was great, near to lots of restaurants and shops - at night, in the Quartier Latin, lots of people are there to enjoy the evening, having dinner or a glass of wine, beer... The room had a very beautiful view of the street, and was quiet and very peaceful, in a perfect size for a couple. The decoration was very charming as well, and the staff was very supportive and friendly. I totally recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value; comfortable, clean and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: RyguyC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days during July and loved it; the location is perfect, it's quiet yet only a block away from a all the shops and food you could want. The hotel staff were very friendly, the room was clean, comfortable and large by european standards; it even had an actual double bed.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: DRNBGHRS
Reviews.Content: I'm looking forward to returning here. I stayed for two nights and found the staff welcoming and the room cosy and peaceful. The simple, beautifully chosen decor suited the building well. The location is great - in a quiet pedestrianised street opposite a beautiful church. The wonderful bookshop Shakespeare and Co is just round the corner. The nearby Monoprix store at 24 Boulevard St Michel is handy for picnic food etc (tip - ignore the food selection on the ground floor and head for the main food department in the basement, which has a huge selection and some cheaper prices, eg €0.22 for a small bottle of mineral water rather than €1.90).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Shep109
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Hotel Parc Saint Severin for two nights for a long weekend in Paris. This was our second stay and the hotel was a good as we remembered. I cannot fault anything about the hotel, the location is perfect - in the busy Latin Quarter but on a quiet street next to Saint Severin Church. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby and only 5 minutes walk to Notre Dame. We stayed in a standard room on the corner of the hotel which was a decent size and nicely decorated. Nice bathroom which was clean and the room had a very comfy bed which is just what you need after a day's sightseeing around Paris. We had breakfast in the hotel. At 14€ it may seem expensive but it is very good value compared to local cafes. (Breakfast at the hotel is buffet style and you can have as much as you like - lots of choice - cereal, fruit, bread, croissants, cheese, cold meat, plus tea coffee and fruit juice) I would not hesitate in recommending the Parc Saint Severin and we will definitely stay there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff”
Reviews.Author: Marce_LCh
Reviews.Content: The Parc St. Severin is a nice little hotel in one of Paris' best locations. The hotel is definitely not new but the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The breakfast is not the best but ok for the price. But the best of the hotel is the staff! They are very friendly, the helped me in everything I asked for: taxi to take me to the airport, wake up call, to do a late check out, reservations for city tours, extra towels... The hotel has city guides and Paris related books in various languages, umbrellas, a computer with a huge screen, internet and color printer, pencils and note pads, a nice sitting area with water and glasses… Great place just between the V and VI arrondissement!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: savvi10
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was very pleasant. We were offered an upgraded room which was very clean and comfortable and had a very nice balcony which offered great views of the area. Also the hotel's location is ideal for exploring the city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: RBCOSTA
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (walking distance to Cluny Museum, Notre Dame, Sainte Chapelle, Conciergerie, Quartier Latin old streets. Nice daily staff (not so good at night). Room #11 needs refurbishing - management needs to care for the room and furniture maintenance. Expensive breakfast with no value to what you get (no refills to orange juice and breads).

Reviews.Title: “Clean , comfortable ,friendly and a great locaton”
Reviews.Author: Lundylupin
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, the room was clean and comfortable with a view of Saint Severin Church and beautiful geranium filled window boxes. The staff could not have been more helpful and attentive. Also there is a kettle in the room and tea and coffee, still not too common in all French hotels The only downside was that it could get quite noisy at night but then it is in a tourist area. However you can close the windows and switch on the air conditioning. It was a shame that breakfast was not included and cost another 14 Euros each but there are local cafes . We will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mtraveler93
Reviews.Content: When I first entered the room it seemed so tiny!!!!! The bathroom was also old but the place was clean. And it was a fantastic location, in terms of getting down and doing things late and returning. The staff were friendly. One particular lady actually walked up the road to find us. The lift is that typical tiny matchbox lift common in Europe. For someone who travels through Asia, that is first shocker. There is nothing fancy, but it is a great place to stay for location and it is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: Passaparola
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed to find that the rooms are not in the condition as described, especially bathrooms, that are warn out, poorly maintained and not even cleaned properly (mouldy, missing grout, dirty toilet , warn out bath tub glazing, tiles etc.). We saw three rooms and the condition of all these rooms was similar, such as peeling paint, dirty and damaged doors and stained coffee/tea facility bench (with plenty of crumbs left from the previous guests). Total dissatisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: itsingers
Reviews.Content: We think this is a great hotel. We first stayed here 20 years ago! Each time we have returned to Paris it has been fully booked, so we were delighted that we could get accommodation this time. The location could not be better and the staff all just so very friendly and super helpful. Whilst the rooms may be a bit small they are extremely comfortable whilst the bathroom was first class. We had a room with a terrace so could enjoy the views and a drink on the terrace. This hotel is great value for money - don't expect the Ritz - just good old fashioned service and comfort. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “ideal location in paris”
Reviews.Author: lou218104
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend in Paris with my mum and don't feel we could have picked a better location. Only a 5 minute walk from the Notre Dame and shopping area, and if like us you enjoy getting out and walking about it isn't that far to any of the sites in Paris. The area around the hotel was full of life 24 hours great for having a late meal or a few drinks at the end of a long day sightseeing, but yet when you were the in the hotel there was no noise from outside to disturb you. The staff were very friendly and helpful both at reception and the cleaning staff. The only downside is the rooms are quite small, but they have everything you need and being a city as beautiful a Paris you only really need the room to sleep in and get ready and for that it was ideal

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AHolidayGuy
Reviews.Content: After reading so many good reviews of this hotel, I was left disappointed. The location is wonderful - just 5 minutes from Notre Dame and The Seine, with numerous restaurants nearby. The train is also just 5 minutes away. The hotel though was of a poor quality. My room was small, it looked old. The bathroom was so basic. In all other hotels I stay they have at least two towels, in this there was only one. The internet wasn't great either. All in all, I found this hotel to be absolutely mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Nota37
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven days stay . Paris was beautiful though so cold especially for travellers like us coming from a warm country like Cyprus. The hotel was very nice.At first we slept in room 34 for one night but my husband didnt find the bed comfortable enough so we upgrated to a superior room (12). That room was beautiful,like a small suite,a corner one, with many windows, nice parisian decor and a warm modern bathroom with double sink and big shower.The room had a small fridge ,coffee facilities,free Wifi and a small lounge with 2 armchairs.Though in a very busy area we didnt hear any noise and had a very nice sleep.The personnel were very polite and the location is excellent, close to everything you need,metro,restaurants,coffee shops,sightseeings etc.The only thing that we didnt like was that there wasnt a central heating in the room ,only airconditioning,and since we are not used to cold(Cypriots!) we asked for a heater and we were more than fine.The central heating in the bathroom was excellent though.Yes, we would stay again in this hotel in our next visits since we found it very clean,inviting and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as before”
Reviews.Author: Honeygatherer
Reviews.Content: The women staff at the Reception were very friendly and helpful as was the lady serving petit dejeuner. The location is fantastic. The men staff were strangely neither. The room was dirty on the first day and the staff was reluctant to do the room after 130 pm on the first day. I had stayed in 2008 and found the next category room large cheerful and good value for money. This a deluxe suite on the terrace was depressing, had a sad grey blue carpet, not enough lighting and was not good value for money at 400 Euro a night. It had been much better earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, room, bath, breakfast, and service”
Reviews.Author: 347NY
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I spent four nights here. I learned about this place because colleagues of a friend recommended this company's Place Vendome hotel, the Mansart. It wasn't available when I was booking so I stumbled onto this one on their website and am very glad I did. I was showing Paris to my son for the first time (I've been several times before). We got a winter special price (nonrefundable), which was reasonable, considering prices in Paris. The Parc Saint-Severin is ideally located for sightseeing. The metro, RER A, B and C are all within two blocks. We had a superior twin with a nice little terrace (couldn't use it due to the weather) and a huge bathroom. Breakfast was excellent. One morning the very nice lady who oversees petit dejeuner service put on her coat and gloves and went out on the icy, snowy streets to the boulangerie to get croissants and pain au chocolat for the two of us because she had run out of them. Incroyable! The staff of the hotel all were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good service”
Reviews.Author: MaxyJaxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Hotel Parc St. Severin,the 30 & 31 of October. We had room 61. Location: perfect location for discovering Paris. Louvre: 2min/foot, Le Marais & place Pompidou : 10min, shopping area : 15min. Popular street with a lot of bars & restaurants only 30m from entrance. Those streets are very crowdy, but the hotel itself is a quiet island. Only remark: the hotel has no own parking, but there is an underground public parking at 5min walking distance (26€/24h) Room: We had a superior room, very spacy for Paris, with a balcony with a table an 2 chairs. We had the St Severin church right in front, with a beautiful view of the roofs of Paris, so this is very cosy (if the neighbouring room is not on his terrace too, because the divide between the rooms is a little fence.) The bed itself was very comfortable, and the bathroom was simple, but clean. We had no noise from the street, nor from the church in front (no clocks, even on a Sunday), just a little bit from the room above us. Free wireless, but slow Breakfast: basic breakfast, fresh but not much choice. A bit overpriced. Service: Beatrice, the person who is at the reception, is a very friendly person, who gave us a very good service. Se helped with everything, including a great restaurant with seafood (la Coupole). This hotel is a good choice for a romantic getaway at a central location!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant convenient place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nzcharles
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant little hotel with a very Parisienne atmosphere. The location just 5 minutes from Notre Dame could not be better.We walked everywhere.the room was tiny but that is the norm for Paris and the elevator eaves smaller and slow. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It is walking distance to dozens of good restaurants and the staff recommended very good ones. We will stay here again next time we are in Paris. The Internet is free but annoying to log into every time you use it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tealedublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August 2010. I would definitely recommend the hotel, the room was a very decent size and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is great too, right in the heart of the Latin Quarter but on a side street, so there was no noise at night. I'm definitely going back to stay here the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This is a little gem of a hotel, great...”
Reviews.Author: CMMB1977
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a hotel, great location just a couple of hundred yards from Notre Dame, 100 yards from Cluny La Sorbonne metro station and right in the heart of the many bars and restaurants in Saint Germain. It is fantastic value for money for central Paris and the staff were very friendly and spoke great English. The rooms were on the small side but were immaculate and had everything we needed, safe, minibar, air-con, flat screen tv, hairdryer etc etc. If I returned to Paris I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice staff, okay quality...”
Reviews.Author: AshGator1
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel in a fantastic location, but I was expecting much more based on the reviews I've seen! Maybe my standards are too high for what was expected for the price I was paying, after all it is Paris. The rooms were small and dated, but clean. The elevator only fit 2 people, breakfast was very pricey, but the staff was pleasant. The location was perfect - just steps away from the lively Latin Quarter and the Notre Dame cathedral. I would stay here again, but the quality is more like that of a 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service and value make this my favourite Paris hotel.”
Reviews.Author: luckjon
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel (29 rooms) just a few minutes walk from the River Seine, Notre Dame and the dozens of cafes and restaurants in this area of the Latin Quarter. Despite being so close to the centre of Paris, its location in a side street behind St. Severin church was surprisingly quiet. My wife and I regularly have a four or five day break in Paris each August. We have stayed in higher rated and more expensive hotels, but Parc St. Severin had it all and is now definitely our favourite. Our 4th floor room was spotlessly clean and well equipped. The staff could not have been friendlier and more helpful and as we got a late deal, the price (for central Paris) was good value. I agree with other comments, that breakfast did not match the rest of the hotel's standards and at 14 euros was expensive. There are dozens of cafes within a few minutes walk where a coffee and croissant can be had for 4 or 5 euros. We are already looking to our next visit to this delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourselves.....”
Reviews.Author: Bonne_08
Reviews.Content: We came across this hotel at the last minute when we were looking for somewhere to stay for an extra two nights in Paris. What a find! Carolina was welcoming and happy to show us the available rooms for my husband, our daughter and me. We were thrilled with our room on the 7th floor. It was a treat after the cramped quarters of our previous hotel close by. A large room on the corner with an enormous private balcony which wraps around the entire room, encompassing views of Sacre Coeur, Notre Dame, the Pantheon and the Eiffel Tower with the historic Church of Saint-Séverin right below us. No more restaurants for us - we spent our 2 evenings there relaxing on the balcony with dinner of antipasti, cheese, bread and wine, enjoying the panorama as the sun set over Paris. The room had an enormous double bed with an extra bed added for our daughter. The bathroom was spacious and well equipped and the air-conditioning was very efficient. Yes, the carpet was a little worn and the furniture a little old, but the super-convenient location, the view and the spaciousness of the room more than compensated. Other reviewers have commented on the lack of noise due to being a little removed from the main thoroughfares of the Latin Quarter. This is a fact – even with our doors and windows opened the noise was not a problem. This is not a cheap room - the hotel has others of course which are less expensive. However if you are looking to treat yourselves for a few nights, try this room and save on dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lyndlou
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel right in the heart of the 5th arrondisement, only two blocks from the Notre Dame. Rooms were very clean, the staff very friendly and helpful and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. The only negative we can think of is that the breakfast could have offered more choices but apart from that it was perfect for our needs and we would be more than happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location.”
Reviews.Author: asintheflower
Reviews.Content: A Lovely little hotel, the location was excellent for us. It was close to two metro stops and the RER line which fast tracks to the Gare du Nord and Gharles de Gaule airport. The hotel was tucked back in a side street from the main restaurant and cafe area, so there was good choice for meals and snacks but we weren't kept awake by noise. The area is lively and full of character at night but sleepy in the morning. The rooms were clean with crisp linen and the beds were comfortable. The staff were nice and friendly with excellent English. My daughter requested extra pillows and was given them promptly and when my son managed to lock himself out of his room, the incident was dealt with in a pleasant, good-humoured way. There was a computer in the small downstairs lounge with internet access and my daughter was given a code for wi-fi which she used for her i-pod touch. The lounge was very small but comfortable with a bookcase full of books you could borrow. There was a mini bar in the rooms and room service was available but if you want a hotel with extensive bar, restaurant and lounge facilities then this probably isn't the place for you. It was perfect for us as we wanted a base to explore Paris. We would certainly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly, light-flooded rooms in classic Paris locale”
Reviews.Author: DorothyMD
Reviews.Content: Have been several times to Paris without children, usually staying at Hotel des Sts. Peres, a quiet place near the Bon Marche, and a sister hotel to Parc Severin. But because we were bringing our children - ages 18, 17 & 6, we needed more spacious, "lighter" rooms with views, plus a more lively location for teens, albeit still off the main drag for noise control. Parc St. Severin fit us to a tee. On the high end for a 3 star, and priced accordingly - book early for summer deals (which we missed by booking last minute when the hotel was nearly full). We had two "superior rooms" - one with a terrace, and the other an expansive room with no terrace but an entire wall of 3 or 4 windows. Both opened onto the 12th century church - L'Eglise St. Severin. The view and ambiance could have been straight out of Hollywood. Head southwest of Blvd St. Germain for beautiful little streets and brasseries. Rue Maubillon area for elegant Brasseries and Rue Bonaparte for high-end shopping.The adjacent street - Harpe, is good for ice cream but a little carnival-like for dinner - bustling with young families. We loved the Brasserie a few steps from the hotel on the corner of Blvd St. Germain - I think it was called Latin. Best of all was the Crepe stand on BSGermain next to the brasserie. Amazing breakfast for under $3. Staff at hotel were extremely nice and patient with our million questions. EVERYBODY both working and staying in the hotel were delightful.

Reviews.Title: “To Paris With Love”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeB
Reviews.Content: OK, so I'm a romantic. On each visit I fall in love with Paris again. Now I'm in love with the Parc St. Severin (and Mlle. Beatrice, one of the front desk staff). The hotel's Latin Quarter location is outstanding, close to the Cluny/Sorbonne metro, a block from the Seine and Notre Dame. It's also a short walk to a variety of great French and ethnic restaurants, galleries and affordable shopping. The hotel is on a little side-street across from a church so in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the area, the rooms are relatively quiet even with the windows open. The A/C worked perfectly and both the room and bathroom were spacious. I was puzzled by the plastic glasses in the bathroom, a surprisingly tacky touch to an otherwise rather stylish hotel, but other than that little quirk it was a wonderful stay in a charming room in a delightful small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Latin Quarter--great location. Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: mrose59
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to great bus line, Notre Dame and the Hop on, Hop ooff tour bus! Great staff...........Beatrice was wonderful. Latin quarter area exciting with restaurants and discos and all the various restaurants. Good tub with shower head!

Reviews.Title: “Quite expensive but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: pitytata
Reviews.Content: Great place in a great location. Metro, food, you can walk for lots of places from the hotel. It,s quite small but is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, price, experience”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaBill
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights in Paris with family - and conducted extensive research on Tripadvisor and other travel guides before settling on a hotel. We weren't looking for high-end, but not a hostel, either! We wanted a nice hotel, great location, air conditioning, good price since we had to have 3 rooms. We found all and more with the Hotel Parc St. Severin. The staff was wonderful and laughed at our silly questions and predicaments (I kept locking myself out of my room safe). It is a perfect hotel, located steps away from the metro/RER station, near Notre Dame and the St. Germain/St. Michele areas. You can't go wrong staying here - save yourself the trouble of all the research I did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and great location - but some issues”
Reviews.Author: quixote43
Reviews.Content: Sounds like we stayed here at the same time as Gemini607 - no air conditioning and no elevator! When we initially arrived we were warmly greeted by the young woman at the front desk, who showed us the computer (free internet), lounge and breakfast areas, and elevator. We took the elevator to the 5th floor and immediately fell in love with the room! Tasteful decor, lots of books, flowers in bloom in the window box, and a nice view. It proved to be the perfect location for exploring Paris and catching the Metro. The next morning we splurged and had breakfast at the hotel - it was quite expensive for what we got and should have been included in the price of the hotel. However, we did find other restaurants nearby for future breakfasts. And then the heatwave hit! We were also told that the air conditioning hadn't been turned on yet and since it was a long weekend they couldn't get anyone in to start it up. And since it was a long weekend it was far too noisy to leave the window open on Saturday or Sunday! While I understand that the heatwave wasn't anticipated, the hotel does advertise air conditioning so it should have been available. We did find that during the week the area was MUCH quieter, even at night. The elevator did break down and it was repaired the next day despite it being a long weekend - for us this wasn't a huge inconvenience and it was only temporary. These things happen and it was only out of order the one time during our 6 day stay. We loved the room and location, and the price seemed on par with other hotels in Paris. We would probably stay here again depending on the time of year and anticipated temperature!

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: Gemini607
Reviews.Content: I have worked at a hotel front desk in a large city and I understand how demanding the job can be. I also understand the value of treating people properly in the hospitality industry. When we arrived to check in, the man at the desk said "Bon soir." I gave him my name and he handed me a key. I asked (in French) where the elevator was. He pointed to the corner,then stood up and walked away from his desk. He did not say a single word to us and my husband said to me "did we do something wrong?" It was not a good beginning. When we travel in late spring and early fall, we always choose hotels with air conditioning so that we will be comfortable in case we hit warm temperatures, and we are willing to pay more for our rooms in order to have that feature. So when I book a hotel that advertises A/C and then happen to be in Paris when the temperatures are unseasonably high like they were last week,I expect not to have to swelter in my room. One evening, after we could not figure out how to turn on our A/C, I called the front desk for help. The man said , 'We have not turned on the A/C. Maybe we will turn it on tomorrow. If you are hot, open the window!' In spite of all the comments that have been posted here about how quiet this hotel is, sleeping with the windows open means that you smell the food and hear the sounds from the restaurants below, the racing scooters and police sirens, the drunken revelers at 3am, and the nearby construction crews unloading trucks at 7 am. We felt quite misled by the hotel's advertising. The elevator did not work for almost 24 hours. The hotel has 7 floors and we saw people struggling with luggage they did not expect to have to carry up and down stairs. The man at the front desk Sunday morning was not particularly helpful and could not give us any idea when the elevator might be working again, and it had not been working since the night before. There were ants in our bathoom- we just killed them ourselves. For our next trip to Paris, we will choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller1983
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel really good value and with a great location. We booked under a pre-paid rate on special on the hotel website and we were very happy with the price paid 125 Euro for 2 Adults for our stay in late April 2010. By Paris standards the rooms were an OK size, tidy with a LCD on the wall. The bathroom was a little dated and in need of some repairs. Hotel also had free wi-fi vouchers from the front desk; this was very handy as we had our laptop with us. We didn't do the breakfast, we thought it was much cheaper to walk to the local bakery and try out all the beautiful pastries and croissants each day instead. There was no shortage of restaurants in the area for dinner also. We would be happy to stay here again, we really liked the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic home base for week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ThePBR
Reviews.Content: Hotel Parc St. Severin was a wonderful location for our 8 day Paris stay. We had a superior room on the 6th floor with a lovely balcony. Close to everything, yet a quiet room, this hotel is the perfect Latin Quarter location. There are a variety of restaurants and shops surrounding the hotel - so you have quick access to whatever you may want. Easy walk to St. Michel metro stop for our visits to Montarnasse and the Saint Ouen Antique & Flea market on Sunday, as well as the RER train to Versailles Palace. Within walking distance to the Pantheon, NotreDame, Sainte Chapelle, Palis de Justice, Centre Georges Pompidou, and Chatelet les Halles. Access to a PC in the lobby was helpful. Each morning we found nice treats at various tea houses and pastry shops and fantastic restaurants for dinners. Lovely location & service.

Reviews.Title: “Treated with the utmost courtesy”
Reviews.Author: Lisburnboy
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at the parc st. severin for 4 nights in April, then got caught up in the delays due to the ash cloud and went back and stayed for several more nights, the staff during our stay were excellent, helping us with enquiries about our onward journey etc, the hotel itself is in an excellent location right in the heart of the latin quarter, 20 yards from the hustle bustle of the lively restaraunts and bars, the rooms are very adequate for a few nights stay and the standard of cleanliness is very high, breakfast is the norm for most hotels in europe, continental or buffet, and the ladies in the breakfast room are very friendly and good natured, we would most certainly recommend the parc st. severin to any of our family or friends going to paris.

Reviews.Title: “This is a lovely small hotel in an excellent location in the center of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: CATravelers4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hôtel Parc Saint-Séverin from April 1 until April 4, 2010. We had beautiful views from our sixth-floor rooms, which were clean and comfortable. The central location makes it possible to walk to so many sites around Paris, such as the Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, and Eiffel Tour. We really liked having breakfast at the hotel each morning. We were greeted by a warm “Bonjour!” from the woman who works in the kitchen. The breakfast buffet was delicious and convenient. We would definitely stay in this hotel again, and we recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: AEtravelling
Reviews.Content: For the price and location we were extremely happy with the quality of the hotel. It was just perfect for what we wanted. In Paris standards this is good value, the room is more modern and spacious than expected. And the location is fabulous. The guy who helped us at the service desk (wish I remembered his name) was excellent and helped us with restaurant tips (the restaurant next door was great after arriving late from the Eurostar and not wanting to go too far).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Parisian Stay”
Reviews.Author: sgeorges3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a very pleasant week at Hotel Parc. St. Severin. As previous travelers have written the location is perfect - on a quiet street in the heart of the Latin Quarter. The rooms are comfortable and very clean, the staff is attentive, friendly, and most helpful. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel - as we fell in love with Paul Salon du The and ate there each morning. Of the entire staff I'd like to single out Corrine who was particularly cheerful and friendly. I also had a good chance to practice my French. You can spend a good bit more for a four star hotel in the Latin Quarter, but our recommendation would be to save the difference and spend it on great dinners. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, quiet and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: shoo-in
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel to be a real gem. just 1 block from the nightlife of the Latin Quarter on a pedestrian street. 2 blocks from the metro and many many restaurants of varying quality all around. The hotel is not fancy but the room was larger than expected and the bathroom was immaculate. If you are looking for a smaller boutique type hotel this is for you. All the employees were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Struggle to do better.”
Reviews.Author: Coombe07
Reviews.Content: For value, location, service and room quality you would struggle to find somewhere better to stay than this. Couldn't believe how quiet the rooms were despite it's ideal location. Have stayed in a few Paris hotels and for the money this has been the best.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Barleyman-SD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 4 nights in September. We had fantastic weather, and our experience at this hotel exceeded expectations. It is a great location, walkable to the Metro/RER, Notre Dame, Louvre, Cluny, etc. SInce our trip was short, we wanted to be in the middle of it. The folks at the front desk were especially helpful, and I was surprised at the 'Standard" room. We had plenty of space, king sized bed, and a nice view of the streets of the Latin Quarter. I would definitely recommend for someone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Left Bank Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BunkyVA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in at least a half dozen small left bank hotels over the years. We have never been completely satisfied, but this year we were. The Hotel Parc St.-Severin is the best. It's location on a small square near the lovely St.-Severin church in the heart of the Left Bank is perfect. The room was large (on Left Bank standards) and very comfortable. The people at the reception desk couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. A computer is available in the lobby, though it's busy. This Hotel is a great find but, be aware, others have discovered it and you may need to reserve far in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated, with only a small amount of noise.”
Reviews.Author: RosiesPosies
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly situated with nearby food/amenities/tourist attractions (steps away from Notre Dame). The room was tiny (hence the lower score), the lift was smaller, but overall, this was a great place to stay. The internet was faster and better than what we had in central London. The folks there were friendly and willing to answer any questions. The only negatives were 1 - the noise from a nearby cafe at night and I'm sure that other rooms might not have had that issue and 2 - the room was literally tiny (but clean and comfortable).

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: connery1
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the hotel for two nights in August. We loved everything about it -- the people, the rooms, the location, the decor, the atmosphere, the breakfasts. Everything was wonderful and I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Paris. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Go there - and enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: CrookDenmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in August. It was great, Location in Paris is good, rooms are fine and the people working there is more helpfull than I have met at 5 stars business hotels. This is going to be my favourite hotel in Paris for weekend trips.

Reviews.Title: “Staff at Parc Saint-Severin are as kind as your favorite friend and the accomodations are equally as pleasant”
Reviews.Author: marykaypa
Reviews.Content: The staff of Hotel Parc Saint-Severin are FANTASTIC! They went out of their way to be kind, helpful, considerate, always friendly, (I can not say enough about the kindness those who work there showed to my mother and I in July 2009. I, if I could remember all the names, would name each and every staff member individually for their kindness. The room was very pleasant with a lovely view (At times you could hear noise outside, when the windows were open. This should be expected in this GREAT location in the center of EVERYTHING. The room we were given seemed very luxurious, in that it came equipped with A/C.There is definitely a fun night life, for those who wish to participate, happening in this wonderful neighborhood.) The morning breakfast is most tasty and is always presented by the most pleasant of company. We found the location to be central and very easily accessible to any and everything throughout Paris (There are any number of bus lines within a block in many directions, as well as at minimum six different Metro lines.) I hope people will enjoy their stay at the Parc Saint-Severin as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: maestracarol
Reviews.Content: My mother and I were visiting Paris for the first time and couldn't have felt any more welcome and at home during our 9 night stay. Carolina was very friendly, playful and always eager to help us with whatever we needed. Fatima made us feel like long lost relatives even though we ate only once at the restaurant. Corinne was warm and a good source of information. Maxime even put a newspaper in our room when we forgot to pick one up. The room was comfortable, clean and had a pleasant street and church view. The location was perfect with a metro nearby and lots to see in the neighborhood. We loved Paris and would absolutely return to this hotel any time we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: LondonCarioca
Reviews.Content: The location is excellect, being very near to Notre Dame and so many other of Paris' famous sites, yet in a reasonably quiet sidestreet. Our room was large by Parisian standards (I have stayed in smaller rooms in 4 star hotels) and was clean and comfortable. For the money, it was the best we have come across.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ColetteFC
Reviews.Content: We were 3 couples at the hotel. We all enjoyed our stay. We appreciated the location. It was at a walking distance to all major attractions. Clean room with comfortable bed, recently renovated bathroom, good size shower with plenty of hot water, refrigerator and safe in the room, acceptable size room with closet and cupboards for storage. Large lift, computer in lobby (10 Euros for one week, unlimited use), friendly and helpful personnel at front desk. We had a room facing the street (on 4th floor). We didn't hear the noise from the street if we closed the window and the curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mr219
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Parc St Severin for 9 nights in mid-June 2009. We were in Room 33, a comfortable double (spacious by Paris standards) with private bath/WC. We have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions, and have consistently enjoyed our visits. The price has gone up over the years (our room was 190 euro/night), so it is no longer the bargain that it once was, but still I would stay it was worth what we paid (especially considering the Trip Advisor reviews of other hotels that cost even more) and we will definitely return. What we liked most: * Comfortable airy room (lots of windows) * Friendly staff (desk personnel, breakfast server, chambermaids) * Great location, close to Notre Dame and Rive Gauche attractions * Efficient air conditioning (but the weather was cool enough so that we didn't need it too much) What we liked least: * More outside noise than we had remembered on previous visits, especially on Friday and Saturday nights. This was probably due to the great summer weather, our room being on a lower floor than in the past and thus closer to the alleyway, and the fact that we did not have the air conditioner turned on. Noise was generally not so much an issue during the week, but there was lots of hooting and hollering etc on the weekend till the wee small hours. * Breakfast was expensive (at 13 euro/person/day) but it was convenient taking the buffet at the hotel so we did. A few additional observations and suggestions: * The elevator was smallish (room for two persons comfortably, or one person with luggage) but typical for Paris hotels. I've seen elevators that are much smaller :-) * The desk staff were all fluent in English. * We bought a route map for the Paris buses and used buses rather than the Metro for most of our travel around the city. This was due in part to the fact that my wife has bad knees, and the stairs and correspondences at the Metro would be uncomfortable. But even if one has healthy knees, buses are a great way to see some of the city, and there are lots of bus lines that run down either Blvd San Michel or Blvd St Germain. * One of our favorite restaurants (Pastavino) had closed down, but we discovered two new ones that are excellent, and both are within easy walking distance of the hotel: La Jacobine (in a pedestrian alleyway off of St Ande des Arts), and La Rotisserie d'en Face (on Rue Christine). We had dinner twice at each one, and all of the meals were great. Price was around 70 euro (Jacobine) and 100 euro (Rotisserie) for 3-course dinner for 2 with wine. * One of the more annoying Paris rip-offs is that when you order a taxi to pick you up, the meter will show a charge based on where the taxi was coming from; this can easily be 10 euro or more. It is more economical to walk to a taxi rank and get a cab there. The closest one to the hotel is at the Quai St Michel. * Although by now everyone probably knows this, do not get currency at the Changes; instead, use your bank ATM or checking debit card at an ATM machine ("Distributeur") in Paris. This will get you a better exchange rate and, depending on your bank, might not entail any fee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian setting with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: lizette136
Reviews.Content: Ambiance, cleanliness, charm. Fatima's omelette will warm your heart! Lovely rooms, sights and sounds of the church bells, children in the courtyard, birds singing. Simple elegance and perfection in every single way. True Parisian flavor! Would come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraP
Reviews.Content: Hotel Parc Saint severin has been recently renovated and teh room was absolutely great! We stayed there last weekend of January and had we had a great time! The hotel is in the heart of the latin quarter and a breath away from Notre Dame. The receptionists were always very helpful. I am def going to be staying there next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff but a little noisy at night because heart of St Michel area”
Reviews.Author: vairolaw
Reviews.Content: The hotel interior was a bit dated but easily tolerable. All the staff were helpful and actually gave a tip as to location to "outlets" near Disney paris so we could purchase Longchamps bags at much lower than Paris prices. The hotel is in the perfect location surrounded by food and other all time favs. Also close to metro and RER so schlepping was at a min if we needed to take trains (trired to stay above ground since we had great weather). The room actually had a foyer which could be shut off so my daughter and I could have privacy changing etc. Beds were comfortable and room was clean. Only thing was loud people outside, is also located above restaurant. If you want quite I'd suggest staying a bit further from the main center. Last year stayed near PAntheon, very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BAC42
Reviews.Content: Recently back from a Four Day stay at this Hotel, booked mainly after reading other peoples reviews. Was not disappointed.The Hotel is more or less just accross the Road. ( 5 mins. or so) from the River and Notre Dame and is an ideal base for sightseeing. Breakfast can be had much cheaper in the many local Cafe's but have no complaint,s about the Hotel itself. Lastly we would both like to thank the lovely Beatrice for her Restaurant recommendation and booking for our 25th.Wedding Anniversary. It capped a very Memorable break.

Reviews.Title: “Parc St. Severin and Beatrice--both gems”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelmum
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay at the Parc St. Severin. It's "our" hotel in Paris. We've been many times, and we have tried others, but this is the one we always return to. While it's in the 5th arrondissement in the admittedly touristy area between the Blvds St. Michel and St. Germain near all the Greek and fondue restaurants, that also means that it's central, close to two metro stops, there are always plenty of people around to make it safe, it's fun and exciting--and after you retire for the night, the double glazing on the windows keeps the room quiet. Most of the rooms, at least those in the lower priced brackets, are typical of the standard mall sized left bank hotel rooms, but they are nicely furnished and impeccably clean. A recent remodel also means that the lobby, sitting room and breakfast room are all stylish and pleasant. They have a nice supply of travel guides to consult and even a take one-leave one library. But what's best about the Parc is the staff. They are uniformly pleasant, caring, friendly and helpful. Chief among them is Beatrice, the wonderful young woman who most often handles the front desk. She is cheerful, witty, can suggest great places to dine and describes the dishes in animated terms. A recent description she provided of a dessert at a nearby restaurant brought to mind the deli scene from "When Harry Met Sally." By the time she'd finished, I just wanted to shout--"Ill have what she's having." The hotel has a couple of rooms on the top floors with terraces where you can have your breakfast overlooking the spires of the St. Severin Church. These tend to get all the special attention, but whatever room you stay in, you'll be well treated, experience great peace, comfort, cleanliness and excellent service. We return again and again and we shall continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “great location and good value for paris”
Reviews.Author: jumpinhorsedad
Reviews.Content: rooms are small of course for north american standards but cozy and clean. and we also got a legitimate double bed (which is rare for a lot of europe) Comfy and small. Breakfast was a disaster so don't pay extra or count on it as a great start to your day. quiet part of paris and close to everything you want to see and do. great cafe's, bars and restaurants - the selection is fantastic and right around the corner from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: newyorker02
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the staff of the Hotel Parc St. Severin for a great service, professionalism, friendliness, hospitality . After all - friendliness is so important , as you are in the " unknown territory" and don't speak french, -- Corinne Andrivon -- Carolina Mac Fadden -- Beatrice Degott -Serafino They were exceptionally helpful, warm and professional. They helped me with everything ,starting with the safe deposit box, - to sight seeing, to booking the excursions, transportation, advise as to what to see, how not to be late for my flight back, shopping, etc...., They have made Paris warm and accessible.. And the late night staff also deserves the praise - - -Mansouri Ahmed Karim - is ready to help you with any question you might have, Overall - very pleasant experience. Great location, -- within walking distance to major sights of interest.and is safe day and night. There are bus and metro lines that stop within blocks of the hotel. Quiet, comfortable, charming and clean rooms. I've stayed in the hotel for the first time in July and I can't wait to come back. I can't really say enough about how much I like the Parc St. Severin. Thanks for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgalVancouver
Reviews.Content: We Just returned from five nights at the Parc Saint- Severin and it was great. We booked a double room but we were given a double room with a patio. I was surprised how large the room was and the bed was so comfortable . It is in the Latin Quarter but on a very quiet street with some very great restaurants within a 5 minute walk. The room had been newly decorated and was always spotless. The front desk people were so friendly and our taxi was waiting for us when we were ready to leave. When in Paris stay at the Hotel Parc severin. We had a big problem as I left our passports in the safe but Beatrice went out of her way to help us and everything worked out well. She is a truly a great receptionist

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Parc St. Severin!”
Reviews.Author: Hylasgirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our long trip throughout Northern Europe, with a week prior in Paris. I made the reservation with the hotel directly about 8 months out. This was a fantastic place to stay for the money. We stayed in room 43 with a great view. There were windows along the whole side of the bedroom and they continued into the bathroom. We did not hear anything from any room around us. This was a great location, near many many sites and transportation choices. One thing that was very nice about the hotel was the air conditioning. I like a cold room, and the a/c was awesome! The maid turned it off each day when she cleaned, but it really cooled right off again when we returned. The beds were nice and firm. A must for my husband. The elevator is big enough for 3 people... that's it! NO suitcases. My husband had to bring ours up one by one by himself. There was plenty of room for our 5 large suitcases and 2 carry-ons. We did not have the breakfast for the extra charge each morning. There are too many good places to eat. Everyone at the front desk was friendly and spoke perfect English. It is like the other hotels we have stayed in Paris... you leave your key with the desk when you leave and ask for it again when you return. We will definitely stay here again. Hopefully this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Updates”
Reviews.Author: Capitol Hill
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Parc St. Severin at least twice a year over the last 10 years and were thrilled to see that they had done very nice upgrades in lobby and certain rooms. The lobby has been transformed from 70s orange to a very comforting dark blue/grey/green. In the sleeping rooms, the switch to flat-screen hotels saved a bit of floor space and, according to Corinne, the efficient and capable manager, carpeting and draperies were also replaced in some rooms. Of course, all of this came with a pretty steep increase in room rates---from 135 last year for our particular room to 165 this year. The truth is, the 165 euro rate---and more---seemed to be consistent with the rates for other 3-star hotels in the area so it's hard to complain. The plumbing has always been a little uneven---tubs don't drain well and, in fact, some of the tubs are just plain hard to climb in and out of. All in all though, given the location, great staff and recent updates, this continues to be a wonderful Paris hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: violetcrumble81
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 2 nights. The hotel staff were warm, welcoming and very helpful to us. The rooms were very clean and large enough for all our luggage. I will definitely return to this hotel on any future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Sure to Return in the Future!”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyLove
Reviews.Content: An unexpected little gem in the heart of Paris! Fantastic, amazing location close to all the wonderful sites and sounds of Paris. A beautiful, quaint, boutique hotel with old charm, and modern, clean conveniences. Polite, friendly staff. A 3 star hotel which aims to serve its guests a 5 star experience. I will defintiely be returning to Hotel Parc St. Severin! I'm afraid to tell many about this wonderful little gift, as I don't want the secret to get out, making bookings very difficult in the future. I've found a real treasure in this hotel, and I recommend it to all! I will never stay elsewhere while in Paris! I've stayed in many European hotels, so can speak with knowledge of what exists out there in the 3 star category, but by far this hotel has the greatest charm and presence of many in its class! I can't wait to return very soon. Thanks Hotel Parc St. Severin for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “fun LQ location”
Reviews.Author: tricia27
Reviews.Content: Just stayed overnight at the Parc St Severin during a busy 2 1/2 week vacation. The Latin Quarter location is convenient. The LQ is all within walking distance and the Seine, IIe de la Cite -& St-Louis very close by. The Metro is just a few short blocks away for sightseeing. Our room was ready at 11am, and everyone was very friendly from management to housekeeping. Room and bath were very clean, and no one could have been friendlier. Note-The hotel is undergoing refurbishment, and currently all the walls are bare and painted white (hopefully while they await redecorating). It does give a very stark appearance to the hotel, and offers no charm, but for the one night it was fine. The only complaint we had was re taxis. The hotel is tucked away and removed from the main streets, and while a taxi rank is by the Seine, they are not always available. We needed a taxi the next morning since we had too much luggage for the Metro/RER. They were unable to prebook a taxi for the next AM, and said they could just call in the morning. Turns out during morning rush hour taxis were NOT available in the LQ by radio or Taxi rank. Desk called every 5 min, we searched the streets as did the manager once she showed up. Finally after 1 1/2 hours my DH flagged one down. Although they tried hard to get us a taxi, shame on them for not knowing how difficult it would be at that hour and for not suggesting car service, and shame on us for not thinking of it early enough. I may still consider staying there again, but only if I had pre-confirmed transportation or planned to use the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location location!”
Reviews.Author: Quest I
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay. The location is perfect, however, there is a restaurant next door and is pretty noisy until closing time. Our room was practically next door, so it may be quite in the other rooms. The staff is great. The downside was the paint job in the lobby. They were painting in the morning making it impossible to try the hotel's restaurant. But, now the lobby and restaurant look great. It wasn't that big of a deal. I would definitely go back despite the noise.

Reviews.Title: “irresistable,”
Reviews.Author: JOHNNYDODGE
Reviews.Content: I Was tempted to write a bad review of this hotel. I like to keep things I really like to myself, but the staff and hotel are so exceptional that truth must be told. Corrine, the manager, Beatrice, Carolina and Lorrie-Emanuella posess a level of hospitality, intelligence, charm, and technical skills that I have not encountered in all my travels.They have made this complex beautiful city both warm and accessable.I usually don't pay much attention to hotel staff but these women are exceptional. They are for real. I've stayed in several of the rooms that I would categorize from tastefully charming to spectacular. (I can see the Eifel tower, Notre Dame, and the Pantheon as I write this) A couple of friends from the states came to visit yesterday and regretted the apartment they had rented. Every great Paris sight is within walking distance and is safe day and night. I've walked several miles in every directionand have not seen a dicey neighborhood. If you want transportation there must be 15 different bus and metro lines that stop within a block of the hotel. (inexpensive train from the airport as well I can't say enough about how much I like the Parc St. Severin. I came here for the first time in April, came back in May then again in august. It is now October and I must, with some sadness, return to the states. If there is the least bit of romance in your heart you'll find it here at the Parc St. Severin. I could live here. Thanks for a wonderful experience. I'll be back. JOHN P.S. I'M NO PHOTOGRAPHER. THE PICS DON'T DO THE PARC ST. SEVERIN JUSTICE

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small friendly hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: wurzelgirl
Reviews.Content: I returned from a 4 night trip here a week ago. My first trip to Paris (and abroad for 30 years) was in April but on a "luxury" company paid trip - 4* hotel (Ambassador) etc. I couldn't afford this myself this time but as a female travelling on her own with only schoolgirl French, wanted somewhere safe, reliable and troublefree. I picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and a relatively good internet hotel/flight deal. I had room 42 on the 4th floor - plenty of space, massive bed (not sure if room was single or double), good wardrobe/shelf space (might need a few more hangers for two), extra blankets/pillows in wardrobe which also had a self-set PIN access safe. Laundry service available. Well stocked mini bar in fridge under TV but not much space for your own choccy gifts etc. Lighting a bit dark as only 2 table lamps in main part of room. Manual airconditioning with two settings - bliss when you come back overheated. Fairly decent sized bathroom - fine for one, but maybe a bit of a squeeze for two. Daily cleaning was excellent - you choose whether to have clean towels daily. A few minor blemishes with decor and sink but worse at home, to be honest. I didn't speak to staff much - mainly just to hand in/get key - as trip pre-paid and no help needed with itinerary. However, those on reception were always friendly, patient when I attempted my poor French and spoke English often anyway. I heard them helping other guests with queries, bookings etc. Check-in/out only took seconds and they were happy to look after my suitcase for a couple of hours on the final morning. One of the ladies who brought my breakfast up was especially friendly and chatty but my poor French prevented us having much of a conversation. Location mainly was a plus - great transport links with 2 Metro stops very close and one of the main RER stops to go to/from CDG airport (30 mins approx). A couple of minutes walk from Notre Dame and I also walked to a number of other sights from hotel, mainly using the Metro to go further afield or go back at night or to drop off shopping. There is a real buzz in that area - unofficial meeting place at the Fontaine St Michel, shops and numerous bistros/cafes in the streets roundabout. I was a bit put off by some of the eateries in Rue de la Harpe but probably just as I was on my own. I found a couple of nice places to eat - nothing fancy but good value for money (nothing over 25 euros for main meal, dessert and drink) with wide choice and variety of prices. However, if you can't eat cheese, dairy or mushrooms (like me - diet problem not just fussy!) you will have problems as one or more is in most dishes. Location was also a negative. As the area was so busy and so many people around having late meals there was a fair amount of noise in the early hours - shouting, laughing, arguing. The hotel is on the edge of a quiet pedestrianised section and sound from passers though carried more than I expected - I got woken up a couple of times a night. I was also aware of the noise on the boulevards close by - especially the mopeds. (In the hotel itself , it was quite disconcerting to stand in the bathroom and hear the guests in the room above going to the toilet!!) Breakfast was great on the first morning with 2 pieces of fruit but all other mornings only one piece including an inedible banana and there was no hot water for my tea on the final morning. (you tick your choices with any extras on a card you hang on your doorknob). Probably wouldn't have had these problems if I'd eaten it in the breakfast room but it was so nice having a leisurely breakfast in my room with the window open listening to the sounds of Paris waking up and getting the day started. Also the lift is very small - one person, one suitcase. I used the stairs at other times but got a bit dizzy by the time I reached the 4th floor as it's a bit of a tight spiral. The light switch is just inside on the left - I missed it altogether the first time and I don't recommend doing the stairs in the dark! Depite the minor niggles including lack of sleep, I loved staying here and am missing it already. Although I crave the breakfast of the Ambassador (you name it, they had it & as much as you could eat) cost will probably prevent me going there again and Parc St Severin will now be top of my list for next year. A lovely friendly calm oasis in the hustle and bustle of the area and Paris - easy to get to and a great central place to start from for all your sightseeing trips.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for Location”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethMaryland
Reviews.Content: Elizabeth from Maryland August 29, 2007 We have just come back from a 4 night/5 day stay at this small cozy hotel in the left bank of Paris. It took me months to research this trip, taking everything into consideration (cost, location, amenities). If your aim is to absorb as much of Paris in a few days, this is the location for you. The Louvre, Musee D'orsay, Notre Dame, a boat ride on the Seine, the Pantheon and of course the Saint Severin Church are pretty much in your doorstep. Not to mention Cafe's and restaurants on the side streets around the hotel. The staff spoke English and were very friendly and helpful. They had umbrellas for us when it rained one day and helped us find our way around. I just told them where we were going and they plotted out our walking plan and the occassional bus and metro ride. Our room had 2 balconies with cascading flowers, a clean and modern bathroom with a tub and shower, a safe, anda small refrigerator. Basically it was clean and simple and roomy enough for Paris standard. It was elegant without going over the top. I'd been to Paris a couple of times before and knew not to expect a huge elevator or ice machines around the corner or even a shower curtain in the bathroom (I guess Parisians like to take baths and not showers). We were very happy with this hotel particularly the fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TripGen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice this year so far, in April and in July, and I'm going back again next week (late August). I have stayed at quite a few hotels in Paris over the last 20 years, but have settled on this hotel as my "Parisian home away from home". I travel often with my young adult children (early 20s), and they really like the location. Very touristic area, to be sure, but lively and fun, and close to several Metro and RER stations . As others have said, the rooms are not super-chic, but they are clean, mostly good-sized rooms with nice large bathrooms. Even the small single rooms, one of which my godson stayed in, are really nice with good-sized baths (especially for a French hotel.) Staff is very helpful and friendly. I don't usually take the breakfast because there are just so many choices within 2-3 minutes walk. Do wander outside of this area, however, for more authentic French food, when you tire of the various ethnic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: PokeyPaddler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a small but pleasant, simply decorated room with a nice sized, up-to-date private bathroom. How fortunate we were to have a balcony. Although tiny, it gave the room a much more open feeling and had nice view of the area and the Musee National du Moyen Age, exhibiting amazing tapestries about the middle ages. The hotel is very clean with excellent service, with a very pleasant sitting room and dining room on the main level. The location is ideal. This part of Paris has a relaxed, social atmosphere. Just outside the door of the hotel, along every street, are reasonably priced cafes and restaurants offering the daily Le Menu for a fixed price, as well as the specialties of the house; museums, La Sorbonne and shopping galore. One block and we were at the famous Boulevard St. Germaine and the Metro stop, if one is not up to a walk. Two blocks to the River Seine; three blocks to Notre Dame Cathedral and the Museum below. We walked just about everywhere from the hotel, but took the metro back after a long day the the Musee D'Orsay or the Louvre. An incredible buy for a first rate hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, some problems”
Reviews.Author: TripGuys
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Paris with RyanAir via Beauvais airport. This airport is in the middle of nowhere. So we opted to take the bus into Paris. We purchased the bus ticket right at baggage claim before our bags arrived. This seemed the best option because when we exited baggage claim there was a line forming to purchase tickets outside. The ride took a little more then an hour to get to the drop-off location, where we got on the metro and headed to the center of town. We purchased a 3 day pass for 3 regions. This was the best option since almost everything was in these three regions. Once we arrived at the hotel, about 12:45, we asked for a room. At first they said the did not have a room and it would be an hour or so. After further asking where we could put our bags and if they would be safe, the desk assistant made a few calls and a room became vacant. I wanted to make sure the room was non-smoking and at that point I was informed that there were NO non-smoking rooms in the hotel, however if there is an issue we could open the windows and all would be fine. I was a bit weary, but decided to just go with the flow. As we walked into the small closet size elevator, where our bags could hardly fit inside with us, we pushed floor 3, and then proceeded down the freshly painted drab military gray walls to room 34. I felt as if I was actually on a military ship, the way the lighting hit the grey walls. When we entered the room, it was nicely prepared, however the walls had chipped paint, stains on the beddings and on the carpet. The room did not smell to bad, so we opted to keep it. We had a long flight from Rome so we wanted to freshen up and take a shower. This is when the SHOCK happed. We looked for the shower and could not find it. We did find a bath-tub with a shower wound and no shower curtain. We proceeded to enter the bathtub squatted uncomfortably and had my friend help me shower. This was odd and a bit uncomfortable. We then let the room for a wonderful day in Paris. Our first stop was the Mc Donald’s just around the corner from the hotel. This was a mistake for the fact that both of our hamburgers we got were RAW!!!! When we pointed that out to the manager he was like, what’s the problem. We said we wanted them cooked. He then took them and seriously 15 min. later we received our better cooked hamburgers. I would recommend the Crape maker just outside the door of Mc Donald’s. We came back in the evening, after visiting the many sights in Paris, to rest and go on the Internet. Again this hotel had no Internet access. This was the third hotel with no free Internet access, however I recognized that if I had BOINGO access I would be able to access all these internet points for free. The hotel, however, would sell Internet access for $5 for 45 min access and $30 for a day access. Now this was crazy, since I could use the same network with BOINGO for only $9.99 a month. So note to everyone, purchase BOINGO for only $9.99 a month access before you go on your European vacation and save your self the headache plus expense. So now, at about 12 midnight, the lamp light busted and well everything went out, including the TV. The surge must have blown a fuse. Anyways we decided just to sleep. In the morning we realized that there was a 1/2 drank coke soda in the refrigerator and no tissue in the bathroom. After a quick SQUIRT DOWN by my friend, we headed down the stairs, instead of using the closet size elevator. When we approached the front desk, we had a list of things that needed to be repaired, including asking what happened to the shower curtain and shower. In response to the shower/shower curtain, we were told that in France no one takes a shower and that’s why it’s designed like that. The strange part was, everyone that we noticed in the hotel were Americans. Anyways they said they did have a few rooms with a shower curtain, however since they were fully booked there was none available. They said they would correct the other problems in the room. I also asked about breakfast and was told there was No free continental breakfast here either (come on for $200 a night you would think they would offer you something, right?) So we left and went just around the corner to the same McDonalds and had a Latte and Croissant. Again there was a problem here. I had a discussion with the helper why did they only fill the coffee cup 1/2 way. This was strange since the photo showed the cup being filled up all the way. I asked them to please fill it up all the way and they did not. Anyway, we noticed a Starbucks just across the street and decided to do our future coffee purchases there. When we returned the rooms outlets were working again, and there was tissues were in the bathroom. The towels were the same as from the previous day, and we were told that is because they are being more earth safe in not washing everything every day. There was still no shower curtain. We eventually fell asleep and in the morning, woke to rain. Packed our bags and headed to the airport. For the price of the hotel, its not worth it. It’s no more then a $100 a night hotel for the services they are offering and the visual sight and dirtiness of this place. I’ve been in a lot more hotels nicer then this place for 1/2 the cost. If you must be in the Latin Quarter, then this might be a good option, however I did notice a few other really nice hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The best 3* hotel in Paris for location and value”
Reviews.Author: Pendo123
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews, I was not disappointed.It was in the centre on the Latin quarter ,but very litte noise in the night.We just had a short stay at this hotel,2 nights but if the had the time , we would stay a lot longer,would recommend the PARIS SHUTTLE company for transport from the CDG airport and back ,door to door,it is a bit expensive but it takes all the problems of travel and finding the hotel with the Paris trafic etc. Notre Dame,restaurants,shops and Metro few minutes walk.Most of the restaurants have set meals which will suit your pocket. The hotel was very clean and the staff very freienly and helpful ,you can have breakfast at the hotel for 8 Euros ,but we went to the local bakery for a french brekfast. we travelled around Paris via Batobus, it stops at all the major attractions and you get a ride on the river.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Girlwho
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the location and tripadvisor reviews and I wasn't disappointed. I was thrilled when I arrived at Parc Saint Severin and saw where it was. Even the Shuttle Driver said to me you will have a wonderful time in Paris, this is the best location. I went inside and even though it was 11 am I was able to go straight to my room. I had a standard double room which was perfect for one person, I think for two it would be small but manageable. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean and functional. The location was fantastic, close to restaurants, shops, Notre Dame, Metro etc. The staff were welcoming and helpful. My room faced the square and with the windows closed I couldn't hear a sound. I would highly (in fact I already have) recommend this hotel.
